intro: Calycolpus bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian calycolpus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its bark is smooth and aromatic. Calycolpus bolivarensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
